overview: An original research project will be conducted and a monograph of 5,000 words completed under academic supervision. Preparation for this subject begins in Year 1 when students undertake Healthcare Research: Principles and Designs and new subject Research Project in Human Genomics 1.
Data collection commences in Year 2 and students are required to collect and/or analyse research data, interpret findings and write a monograph to be submitted at the end of Semester 2.
This is supplemented by fortnightly research tutorials, study in existing short courses and other relevant upskilling resources offered by The University of Melbourne.

necessary pre-requisite: with a minimum grade of H2B (70%) or equivalent
additional pre-requisite: with a minimum grade of H2B (70%) or equivalent

assessments.description: Viva presentation of findings - Semester 2 exam period. 10 minutes
Draft conference abstract + 3 minute thesis slide - Semester 1, Week 9. 500 words
Participant feedback letter - Semester 2, Week 12. 500 words
Written monograph 5000 words assessed by 2 examiners chosen by the Board of Examiners (Program Director, Research Coordinator and other senior faculty) - Semester 2, Week 9. 5000 words
Written reflection on research experience (1000 words) - Semester 2, Week 11. 1000 words
Written progress report x3 - Semester 1, Week 3; Semester 1, Week 12; Semester 2, Week 6. 1000 words

Year Long.Contact hours: Regular meetings with supervisors, with at least a total of 72 contact hours over the duration of the project. Regular (usually fortnightly) classes facilitated by the Research Curriculum Coordinator, 24 contact hours in total.

Prescribed texts: No prescribed text. Dissertation handbook will be provided.

Available to Study Abroad and/or Study E: This subject is available to students studying at the University from eligible overseas institutions on exchange and study abroad. Students are required to satisfy any listed requirements, such as pre- and co-requisites, for enrolment in the subject.
